The 43-year-old golfer — 11 years removed from winning his last major tournament — was fighting against a series of devastating injuries and an entirely new generation of competition but with every precision shot he was reminding the world what he once was.

title: Ecuador Plunges Into Crisis Amid Prison Riots and Gang Leader’s Disappearance
description: Gunmen wearing masks stormed a television station in Ecuador’s largest city on Tuesday, taking anchors and staff hostage and exchanging gunfire with the police as cameras rolled before the intruders were subdued and arrested.

title: New York City Hid Realities of Homelessness Crisis, Report Finds
description: As New York City faced a worsening homelessness crisis in recent years, officials repeatedly sought to hide the reality on the ground, according to a city investigation released on Tuesday.

title: Ecuadorean Law Enforcement Searches for Escaped Gang Leader
description: Ecuadorean military and police patrolled the streets and searched residents following the disappearance of an imprisoned leader of a criminal gang.

title: Herman Raucher, Screenwriter Best Known for ‘Summer of ’42,’ Dies at 95
description: Herman Raucher, who turned his memories of a summer as a teenager in a Massachusetts beach town, including one of a sexual encounter with a young war widow, into the screenplay for the nostalgic 1971 film “Summer of ’42,” died on Dec. 28 in Stamford, Conn. He was 95.

title: Hilton Head Native Who Fought Developers to Save Family Land Dies at 94
description: A 94-year-old woman who was at the center of a legal battle with a developer to keep her family’s ancestral land on the island of Hilton Head, S.C., has died.

title: The Truth About Airplane Safety
description: It was only when I attempted to make small talk with my visibly squirming seatmate on a Raleigh-Durham to New York flight that I realized it was me causing that look of horror on his face, rather than the slight turbulence we had been experiencing since takeoff. A friendly chat, I had thought, might help distract him from flight anxiety. But then I noticed his eyes — wide with fear — were fixed on my computer screen, which displayed an investigative report on an airplane crash I had been reading.

title: Federal Judges Cast Doubt on Trump’s Claim of Immunity
description: Donald Trump appeared today in front of an appeals court panel in Washington to argue that he is immune from prosecution on charges of plotting to overturn the 2020 election because they arose from actions he took as president. The three judges on the panel seemed unconvinced, suggesting that they are unlikely to rule in the former president’s favor.

title: Trump’s Immunity Claim in Court
description: It looks like Donald Trump ran into a wall today while pushing his position that he cannot be charged criminally for his efforts to remain in power after losing the 2020 election. It came in the form of three federal appeals court judges.

title: A Hack of the S.E.C.’s Social Media Account Caused a Bitcoin Frenzy, Briefly
description: For 15 minutes, the cryptocurrency industry was euphoric.

title: More Than 1,000 Flights Are Canceled as Extreme Weather Batters the U.S.
description: More than 1,000 domestic and international flights in the United States were canceled on Tuesday as extreme weather pummeled the country from coast to coast.

title: As Political Theater, Trump’s Court Appearance Wasn’t a Showstopper
description: If Donald J. Trump’s goal on Tuesday was to turn a weighty legal proceeding in Washington into a de facto campaign appearance that galvanized media attention, he fell short.

title: In Speech, New Jersey Governor Backs Phonics and Medical Debt Relief
description: Gov. Philip D. Murphy of New Jersey embraced proposals to make it easier to build affordable housing and cut out-of-pocket expenses for abortions in his annual State of the State address on Tuesday.

title: The Secretary of Defense Can’t Go AWOL. Neither Can America.
description: A decade ago, I wrote a book with the subtitle “The New Isolationism and the Coming Global Disorder.” I’ve been wrong about a thing or two (or three) over the years. I wish I had been wrong about this.

title: Secret Synagogue Tunnel Sets Off Altercation That Leads to 9 Arrests
description: A decades-old fight about the direction of one of New York’s most prominent Hasidic Jewish groups tipped into chaos this week, when one faction clashed with the police over a tunnel that had secretly been built to the movement’s main synagogue.

title: 5 Takeaways From Hochul’s State of the State Address
description: In her third State of the State address, Gov. Kathy Hochul on Tuesday laid out her vision for the coming legislative session and described objectives that often were more of a reflection of her moderate roots than the state’s recent progressive slant.

title: Allegations Against Prosecutors Bolster Trump’s Criticism of Georgia Case
description: It seemed an unusual choice when Fani T. Willis, the district attorney in Fulton County, Ga., turned to a suburban defense lawyer to oversee what seemed the biggest task of her career: building an election interference case against former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Natural Gas Played Role in Fort Worth Hotel Explosion, Officials Say
description: Officials in Texas have yet to determine exactly what caused an explosion at a hotel in downtown Fort Worth that injured 21 people, but believe natural gas was involved, Jim Davis, the city’s fire chief, said at a news conference Tuesday evening.

title: A Look at the Panel That Ripped Open an Alaska Airlines Jet
description: A diagram of the door plug shows the locations of critical bolts that federal investigators said may have been missing or improperly installed.

title: Virginia Fisherman Is Linked to Three 1980s Killings, Police Say
description: A Virginia fisherman who died in 2017 was responsible for the killings of three people in two separate cases in the southeastern part of the state that sat unsolved for more than 30 years, the police announced this week.

title: Oligarch’s Aide Tells Court How Sotheby’s Expertise Had Role in Fraud
description: An adviser to a Russian billionaire asserted in a Manhattan courtroom on Tuesday that he and his boss had been tricked by a Swiss art dealer into wildly overpaying for works of art and that a Sotheby’s expert’s opinions played a role in persuading them to pay the inflated prices.

title: Nearly 2,000 Migrants Are Evacuated From Brooklyn Tent Shelter Before Storm
description: New York City evacuated on Tuesday about 500 families with children — nearly 2,000 people in total — from a massive tent shelter set up on a desolate former airplane runway in southern Brooklyn ahead of heavy rains and wind expected to hit the area.

title: Amalija Knavs, Mother of Former First Lady Melania Trump, Dies at 78
description: Amalija Knavs, a former Slovenian factory worker who became a United States citizen with help from one of her daughters, Melania Trump, has died. She was 78.

title: Buds Go in Them
description: Jump to: Today’s Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Review: For Jews, an Unanswered ‘Prayer for the French Republic’
description: Such is the sadness of our world that plays about antisemitism, however historical, cannot help but be prescient. Take “Prayer for the French Republic,” Joshua Harmon’s sprawling family drama about the Salomons, Jews who have “been in France more than a thousand years,” as one of them puts it, still sounding provisional. With violent incidents on the rise, and a fascistic, Nazi-adjacent party gaining in the polls, should they finally seek safety elsewhere?

title: Hochul Warns of Flooding Risks and Lingering Power Outages
description: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York cautioned residents on Tuesday evening about two major storm-related problems that were likely to linger after the system moved on: widespread power outages and the risk of flooding in certain parts of the state.

title: ‘Fargo’ Season 5, Episode 9 Recap: Cowboy Hitler
description: “You Hitler at the Reichstag or Hitler in the bunker?”

title: What to Watch at the Haley-DeSantis Debate and the Trump Town Hall
description: Only two Republicans, Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis, will take the CNN debate stage at Drake University in Des Moines on Wednesday night for the final televised clash before the Iowa caucuses next week.

title: Italian Town Hitches Its Wagon to Plants That Bloom (Even in Winter)
description: Even as the group of flower aficionados flitted around a high-ceilinged room admiring just-clipped camellias with fanciful names like “Pink Lassie” and “Paradise Petite,” single petals floated lazily to the paneled wood floor, forming colorful mounds.

title: Wednesday Briefing
description: At a hearing in Washington yesterday, Donald Trump appeared in front of an appeals court panel to argue that he is immune from prosecution on charges of plotting to overturn the 2020 election because they arose from actions he took as president. The three judges on the panel seemed unconvinced, suggesting that they are unlikely to rule in the former president’s favor.

title: ‘Why Would Trump Win This Election When He Lost the Last One?’
description: Eight Republican voters from Iowa offer their thoughts on the upcoming caucuses.

title: Quotation of the Day: How Do You Keep a Tidy House? It Helps to Have a Tidy Mouse.
description: “Lo and behold, I got a video of the mouse. Tidying up for me.”

title: Corrections: Jan. 10, 2024
description: An entry in the Dateline feature on Sunday about the places from which Times journalists are reporting misstated the results of the presidential election in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The incumbent president, Felix Tshisekedi, was declared the winner; the country did not elect a new president.

title: What to Know About the Chaos in Ecuador
description: Violence erupted across Ecuador this week after a well-known gang leader disappeared from prison. Explosions, looting, gunfire and burning vehicles were reported, and there were uprisings in several prisons. In the largest city, Guayaquil, gunmen stormed a TV studio during a live broadcast on Tuesday.

title: Late Night Recaps Donald Trump’s Latest Day in Court
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Today’s Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for today’s puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to today’s Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle — and emotional — support.

title: Guards Beat and Waterboarded Prisoners in New York, Lawsuits Say
description: Two prisoners in upstate New York say they were brutally beaten by guards and taken to a different facility to be waterboarded — a method of torture once used by C.I.A. interrogators on terrorism suspects, according to newly filed lawsuits.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: In Newark, 16-Year-Olds Win the Right to Vote in School Board Races
description: Residents as young as 16 have been granted the right to vote in school board elections in Newark, New Jersey’s largest city, beginning in April, after the City Council unanimously approved an ordinance Wednesday lowering the voting age.

title: East Coast Faces Flooding After Day of Rain
description: The heaviest rain from a widespread storm that drenched the eastern United States appeared to have ended in much of the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast by Wednesday morning, but meteorologists said the risk of flooding had just begun.

title: As U.S. Support for Ukraine Falters, Europe Splits on Filling the Gap
description: In Estonia, a four-story banner that combines the flags of Ukraine and Estonia hangs over a main square in the capital, Tallinn. In Latvia, Foreign Minister Krisjanis Karins is calling for allies to “ramp up military support to Ukraine without delay.”

title: ‘We Live in Constant Fear’: Violence Erupts Across Ecuador
description: Chaos has consumed Ecuador after gang leaders escaped prisons and armed men commandeered a live TV broadcast.

title: Knife Attacker Hoped to End South Korean’s Presidential Bid, Police Say
description: The man who stabbed the main opposition leader of South Korea in the neck last week wanted to kill him so that he would never become president, the police said, in an alarming escalation of the country’s political polarization.

title: A Closer Look at What the U.S. Lets You See of Its War Court at Guantánamo Bay
description: The Times explores the place where photography is allowed at Guantánamo's secretive war court — and explains what you can and cannot see.

title: Inside Guantánamo Bay
description: Take a look inside the detention and court operations with Carol Rosenberg, the New York Times Guantanamo Bay correspondent.

title: The EGOT Winner Behind Sondheim’s Signature Sound
description: To understand the role of the Broadway orchestrator, seek out the composer Stephen Sondheim’s piano demo for the song “Losing My Mind” from the musical “Follies” and then compare it to the version on the original cast recording. The demo’s tone is wistful and resigned, with a touch of the whiskey bar about it. In the finished version, the song sounds transformed: Ascending notes on the strings, interjections from the brass and crashing cymbals build to a powerful climax, evoking the heartache and inner turmoil contained in the lyric.

title: Your Workout Routine Isn’t Complete Without Strength Training
description: Anh Bui’s main focus as a physical therapist is to treat and prevent running injuries. Her most common prescription for patients? Lifting weights.

title: These Wedding Vendors Get Paid to Work on Their Phones
description: While searching on TikTok for ideas for her April 22, 2023 wedding, Mila Tweel came across several videos of former brides discussing what they would have done differently. Many regretted not hiring someone to capture behind-the-scene videos and photos of their wedding day.

title: Inside the Mayor’s Closet
description: When Mayor Eric Adams emerges from his official limousine, so too does a glimpse of poplin, chambray and gabardine: some of the New York City mayor’s collection of crisp shirts, tailored suits and custom neckties often travels with him, swinging from a rack in the back seat of his black Chevrolet Suburban.

title: Our Predictions for 2024
description: Every January, we ask our most trend-obsessed colleagues to make predictions about the year ahead. Here are their best guesses about what 2024 will hold for fashion, food, technology and culture.

title: The Agony and Determination of Sderot
description: Until the morning of Oct. 7, the town of Sderot in southern Israel was a parable of hope and success. Less than a mile from the Gaza border, it emerged a few years after the 1948 Arab-Israeli war as a haven for Jewish refugees fleeing antisemitic persecution — from North Africa, Kurdish lands, Ethiopia and the former Soviet Union. I am a second-generation Israeli; my parents found refuge in Israel from Iran.

title: Tina Fey on ‘Mean Girls’ Then and Now
description: Tina Fey spent the summers of 2002 and 2003 hunched over an old desk in the mildewy back room of a Fire Island rental home. Fueled by coffee and Entenmann’s chocolate-covered doughnuts, Fey, at the time the head writer for “Saturday Night Live,” cracked the script that became “Mean Girls” on her laptop.

title: In Florida, New School Laws Have an Unintended Consequence: Bureaucracy
description: Got a cut and need a Band-Aid? Want to be called Will instead of William? Or get your vision checked?

title: A Match Made in Heaven: Pimento Cheese and Flaky Pie Crust
description: In a world in which we hope to be seduced and moved by food, mayonnaise just sits there, daring us all to love it.

title: How to Make the Most of Your At-Home Covid Test
description: While Covid has become a regular part of respiratory virus season, community testing centers and drive-through sites where you could determine whether it’s the source of your sniffles have all but vanished.

title: Food Assistance for Mothers and Children Faces Funding Shortfall
description: For the first time in decades, many states could begin turning away eligible applicants from an assistance program that provides low-income women and their children critical access to food.

title: Writing Is Doomed to Fail. That’s Why Hisham Matar Loves It.
description: Talk to any friends of the writer Hisham Matar, and he has many, and soon they’ll bring up one of his more notorious pastimes: Have you ever seen how he looks at art?

title: Then and Now: Revisiting the Sopranos’ New Jersey 25 Years Later
description: As much as it was a show about Italian American mobsters, “The Sopranos” was a show about New Jersey. From scenes of domestic life in a North Caldwell McMansion to after-hours debauchery at a strip club in Lodi, the show captured a snapshot of the Garden State in the late 1990s and 2000s, beguiling viewers with its regional authenticity.

title: For This Reporter, the War in Ukraine Is Also Personal
description: “Kyiv was still a city at peace,” Yaroslav Trofimov writes about the afternoon of Feb. 23, 2022, the day before Russian forces invaded Ukraine. The sun was shining, the bars were full; he saw no scenes of panic buying at the shops or snaking lines at the A.T.M.s.

title: The Next Front in the U.S.-China Battle Over Chips
description: NASA has chosen the technology to help it land future spacecraft on unmapped planets. Meta uses the technology for artificial intelligence. Chinese engineers have turned to it to encrypt data.

title: Mortgage Rates and Inflation Could Draw Attention to the Fed This Election
description: This year is set to be a big one for Federal Reserve officials: They are expecting to cut interest rates several times as inflation comes down steadily, giving them a chance to dial back a two-year-long effort to cool the economy.

title: Was This Man’s Weakness Related to Recent Oral Surgery?
description: It was early morning when the woman crept into the living room, where her 82-year-old partner was sleeping. He didn’t usually sleep in his recliner but was in and out of bed so many times with diarrhea two nights earlier that she was relieved when he decided to sleep in his favorite chair. His eyes opened as she started to close the door. “I can’t get out of the chair,” he said quietly. His feet were on the floor, but, he told her, he didn’t have the strength to rise or even move. This was a man who, in the 21 years she’d known and loved him, was still only when he was asleep. Now, with his arms hanging limply beside him, his face pale behind his constant New Mexico tan, he looked weaker and sicker than she had ever seen him.

title: The Shadow War to Determine the Next Trump Administration
description: A disturbing sense of inevitability hangs over the Iowa caucuses on Monday. Donald Trump, with a 34-point lead in the polls, is the all but certain Republican nominee. And despite his legal troubles, Mr. Trump leads Joe Biden in several general election polls in swing states.

title: An Ultrasound Experiment Tackles a Giant Problem in Brain Medicine
description: There is a problem with the recently approved Alzheimer’s drug, Aduhelm. It can remove some of the amyloid that forms brain plaques that are hallmarks of the disease. But most of the drug is wasted because it hits an obstacle, the blood-brain barrier, that protects the brain from toxins and infections but also prevents many drugs from entering.

title: We Are in a Big Covid Wave. But Just How Big?
description: The curves on some Covid graphs are looking quite steep, again.

title: U.S. Carbon Emissions Fell in 2023 as Coal Use Tumbled to New Lows
description: America’s greenhouse gas emissions fell 1.9 percent in 2023, in large part because the burning of coal to produce electricity plummeted to its lowest level in half a century, according to estimates published on Wednesday by the Rhodium Group, a nonpartisan research firm.

title: Why Are American Drivers So Deadly?
description: In the summer of 1999, a few years after graduating from medical school, Deborah Kuhls moved from New York to Maryland, where she had been accepted as a surgical fellow at the R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center in Baltimore. Founded by a pioneer in emergency medicine, Shock Trauma is one of the busiest critical-care facilities in the country — in an average year, doctors there see approximately 8,000 patients, many of them close to death.

title: Microsoft Debates What to Do With A.I. Lab in China
description: When Microsoft opened an advanced research lab in Beijing in 1998, it was a time of optimism about technology and China.

title: Setting the Stage for Iowa: ‘Trump Will Probably Be Over 50 Percent’
description: The Republican caucuses in Iowa are just five days away, marking the official start of the 2024 presidential election season. To kick-start Opinion Audio’s coverage, Patrick Healy, the deputy editor of Times Opinion, and the Opinion editor Katherine Miller get together to discuss their expectations for Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis, where they think the G.O.P. is headed and Donald Trump’s continued dominance. Stay tuned for more on-the-ground analysis from “The Opinions” in the coming weeks.

title: A ‘National and Global Maelstrom’ Is Pulling Us Under
description: The coming election will be held at a time of insoluble cultural and racial conflict; a two-tier economy, one growing, the other stagnant; a time of inequality and economic immobility; a divided electorate based on educational attainment — taken together, a toxic combination pushing the country into two belligerent camps.

title: Women’s Hockey Team Breaks Into the New York Market
description: Good morning. It’s Wednesday. Today we’ll find out about New York’s newest professional sports team, which is scheduled to play its first game at UBS Arena at Belmont Park on Long Island tonight. We’ll also check on the state of two states, New York and New Jersey.

title: Why Biden Must Collide With the Democratic Party on Immigration
description: The negotiations on Ukraine funding and stricter border protections have exposed a growing rift between President Biden and his own party. Republican hard-liners have demanded a bill that mirrors policies advanced during the Trump administration, especially ones related to asylum seekers, increased border security and the mandate that companies institute the E-Verify employment eligibility system.

title: $1.3 Million Homes in Florida, Georgia and Delaware
description: This house is near 30A, a 24-mile span of road along the Gulf Coast that connects Santa Rosa Beach to other popular beach communities, including Rosemary Beach, Seaside and Seacrest. It is less than a mile from a public access point to a beach with white sand and gentle surf, and a 10-minute drive from a Publix supermarket and several casual seafood restaurants.

title: Put a Rink on It
description: This winter, for the first time in recent history, it’s possible to ice skate underneath the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: One of Trump’s Oldest Tactics in Business and Politics: I’m Rubber. You’re Glue.
description: Days before the Iowa caucuses, former President Donald J. Trump is appearing twice in court this week — on Tuesday in Washington and Thursday in New York.

title: U.N. Expert Will Investigate Reports of Sex Crimes by Hamas, Israel Says
description: The United Nations’ special representative on sexual violence in conflict has accepted Israel’s invitation to investigate allegations of sex crimes committed by Hamas on Oct. 7, a spokesman for Israel’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Tuesday.

title: After a Day of Unsettled Weather, Here’s the Forecast
description: Much of the United States was continuing to grapple on Wednesday with a mixed bag of unsettled weather — snow, rain, strong winds, flooding and freezing temperatures — that had upended daily life for millions of people from coast to coast.

title: Blinken Meets With Abbas to Talk About Gaza’s Future
description: Antony J. Blinken, the U.S. secretary of state, met on Wednesday with Mahmoud Abbas, the leader of the Palestinian Authority, to discuss Israel’s war against Hamas in Gaza and the role that the authority might play there when the conflict ebbs.

title: All-Female City Council Marks a ‘Turning Point’ for a Twin City
description: There was a moment last summer when Nelsie Yang realized that she and six other women were on the verge of making history in St. Paul, Minn. The group of City Council candidates was knocking on doors to share their joint campaign message, one that could transform the makeup of the city’s governing body.

title: Trump’s Case for Total Immunity
description: Donald Trump has consistently argued that as a former president, he is immune from being charged with a crime for things he did while he was in office.

title: Severe Weather in U.S., and Crisis in Ecuador
description: The New York Times Audio app is home to journalism and storytelling, and provides news, depth and serendipity. If you haven’t already, download it here — available to Times news subscribers on iOS — and sign up for our weekly newsletter.

title: An Immigration Shift
description: Since Donald Trump first ran for president in 2016, the Democratic Party has changed its own approach to immigration. Not long ago, leading Democrats supported immigration enforcement measures like tough border security and deportations. Today, much of the party is uncomfortable doing so.

title: How the War With Hamas Has Damaged Israel’s Tech Firms and Economy
description: At 6:45 a.m. on Oct. 7, Jack Bigio, the founder of the technology company UBQ Materials, talked to his chief operating officer, who said terrorists were on his kibbutz. Other employees texted that they were hiding in safe rooms, and one said her husband had been shot in the stomach.

title: Papua New Guinea Orders Military to Restore Order as Unrest Rocks Capital
description: The government of Papua New Guinea on Wednesday ordered the military to restore order in the capital, Port Moresby, after a dispute over the wages of police officers and other public servants led to angry protests and unrest.

title: Botox Destroyed What I Liked About My Face
description: I tried Botox for the first time two years ago. I was rapidly approaching my 40th birthday, and like so many other people, I spent the early Covid years staring at my increasingly pallid and wrinkled visage through daily video calls. That I succumbed to the expensive allure of cosmetic injectables as a result of this scrutiny was both banal and mildly embarrassing.

title: Word of the Day: kinesiology
description: The word kinesiology has appeared in 12 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on July 6 in “Uncoordinated? You Can Still Be an Athlete” by Jenny Marder:

title: The Big Bitcoin Tease
description: The famously volatile price of Bitcoin briefly experienced more whiplash than usual on Tuesday, after a post on an official S.E.C. social media account said that the agency had approved long-awaited investment products tied to the cryptocurrency.

title: Maps
description: Are you fascinated by maps? Have you ever made one yourself?

title: E. Leo Milonas, 87, a Lion and a Defender of New York Courts, Dies
description: E. Leo Milonas, a resolute jurist who administered New York courts for a quarter-century and was known to rise to defend his fellow judges in public disputes, in one case sparring with Mayor Edward I. Koch, died on Jan. 2 at his home in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. He was 87.

title: At an Emotional Governors Awards, Painful Losses and Heartfelt Tributes
description: Despite the chockablock ballroom full of Hollywood’s best and brightest, a jovial emcee in the comedian John Mulaney and honorees the audience seemed thrilled to celebrate, a pall of sadness was cast over the Governors Awards — an event created 14 years ago by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to shorten the Oscar telecast by relegating the honorary Oscars to its own untelevised confab.

title: Why Does My Sister Want to Be Paid for Being the Executor of My Mother’s Will?
description: My mother passed away in 2021. She left her estate in equal shares to my sister, my brother and me. My siblings were named coexecutors of her will. It was relatively easy to sort out her house and belongings and to distribute the money. My sister insisted on handling everything: “I’ve got it,” she would say when we offered to help. Most of the funds were distributed soon after my mother’s death. But there remains a balance of $150,000. When my brother asked my sister to distribute it, she sent a long email saying she deserves to be paid for her work. My brother and I are surprised, sad and angry: The will doesn’t say anything about paying executors. My sister was an ample beneficiary, and her work was finished 18 months ago. If she wanted to be paid for what I view as an act of love, she should have brought it up at the beginning. Thoughts?

title: The Tech That Needs Fixing in 2024, and What Got Fixed Last Year
description: Tech companies would like us to believe that their products tell a story about progress. Faster phones! Better cameras! Brighter screens! Yet despite all the improvements, there are pieces of tech that have been flawed for years.

title: December Was One of the Warmest on Record in California
description: Despite all the holiday songs about sun-baked beaches and snowless Christmas celebrations, December in California actually tends to be cool and damp.

title: Pat McAfee’s On-Air Slams of ESPN Executive Show a Network Power Shift
description: As it morphs from a television company into a streaming company, ESPN is undergoing rapid transformation. But if the extraordinary events of the past week are any indication, the transformation of its corporate culture is just as seismic.

title: A Super PAC Forms to Support No Labels
description: A political group intending to support a presidential candidate run by the group No Labels plans to file paperwork with the Federal Election Commission on Wednesday, with a handful of Republican and Democratic strategists as advisers.

title: How to Watch Trump’s Town Hall on Fox News
description: Former President Donald J. Trump will join the Fox anchors Bret Baier and Martha MacCallum at 9 p.m. Eastern time on Wednesday for a live town-hall event. It will be broadcast on Fox News and can be streamed at Foxnews.com with a cable login.

title: Iowa Nice vs. New Hampshire Ornery: A Tale of Spurned Democrats
description: When President Biden shook up his party’s presidential nominating calendar, Democrats in the two states that were bounced from the front of the line reacted in far different ways.

title: Democrats Set Ambitious Spending Plan for State Legislative Races
description: The Democratic Party’s organization that focuses on state legislative races is planning its largest campaign budget ever as it seeks to flip five chambers in three critical swing states, as well as defend three recently earned majorities, according to a memo of the group’s 2024 strategy obtained by The New York Times.

title: Effort to Revamp I.R.S. Faces Challenges Despite Funding Infusion
description: A multibillion-dollar federal effort to modernize the Internal Revenue Service has not yet solved the agency’s struggles to answer customers’ calls, ameliorate identity theft or process amended tax returns, the agency’s watchdog wrote on Wednesday in a report to Congress.

title: Tell Us the Little Things You Do for Love
description: Valentine’s Day is just around the corner and, sure, plenty of people dismiss it as a commercialized scam. But for others, the holiday is a welcome occasion to pause and remind your partner what they mean to you (or, at the very least, to eat a little chocolate).

title: At World Court, Israel to Confront Accusations of Genocide
description: The International Court of Justice, the United Nations’ highest judicial body, will begin hearings this week in a case brought by South Africa that accuses Israel of committing genocide in Gaza.

title: How to Watch the Republican Debate Taking Place in Iowa
description: Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis will meet on Wednesday night in Des Moines for the last Republican presidential debate before the Iowa caucuses on Monday.

title: U.S. Diet Panel Adds Another Researcher With Alcohol Industry Ties
description: Shortly after dropping two Harvard scientists with financial conflicts of interest, the national organization assembling a committee to assess the evidence about drinking and health has chosen four new panelists, among them another Harvard professor who also has financial ties to the alcohol industry.

title: Severe Storms Rip Roofs Off of Homes in the Southeast
description: Strong winds and likely tornadoes destroyed several buildings in the Southeast.

title: SAG Award Nominations 2024: It’s a ‘Barbenheimer’ Rematch
description: Box office behemoths “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer” led this year’s nominations for the Screen Actors Guild Awards, which were announced Wednesday morning. Each film picked up four nominations, including ones for the guild’s top ensemble prize.

title: Democrats Question Semiconductor Program’s Ties to Wall St.
description: Two Democratic lawmakers on Tuesday expressed concerns about ex-Wall Street financiers overseeing the Commerce Department’s distribution of $39 billion in grants to the semiconductor industry, saying the staffing raised questions about the creation and abuse of a revolving door between government and industry.

title: More Than 20 Million People Have Signed Up for Obamacare Plans, Blowing by Record
description: More than 20 million people have signed up for plans on the Affordable Care Act’s marketplaces during the annual open enrollment period, far surpassing last year’s record of more than 16 million enrollments, the Biden administration announced on Wednesday.

title: Our Five-Star, Thai-Inspired Chicken Meatball Soup With Over 14,000 Reviews
description: Is there anything cuter or more fun to eat than a meatball? Snuggled into a sandwich, slid onto skewers or perched on top of spaghetti, meatballs are inherently playful — more than their close cousin meatloaf, which is far too square to roll off the table and out of the door.

title: Ancient Skeletons Give Clues to Modern Medical Mysteries
description: Multiple sclerosis, an autoimmune disease that affects 2.9 million people, presents a biological puzzle.

title: The Biggest Ape That Ever Lived Was Not Too Big to Fail
description: Standing nearly as tall as a basketball hoop and weighing as much as a grizzly bear, Gigantopithecus blacki was the greatest ape to ever live. For more than a million years during the Pleistocene, Gigantopithecus roamed southern China. But by the time ancient humans reached the region, Gigantopithecus had vanished.

title: Climate Change Is Driving a Sharp Drop in Snow Levels, Study Finds
description: Changing snow patterns have far-reaching consequences, from water shortages to shuttered ski resorts. A new study confirms that human-caused climate change has affected snow patterns across the Northern Hemisphere, including clear declines of snowpack in at least 31 individual river basins.

title: Trump Promotes False Birther Conspiracy About Nikki Haley
description: Former President Donald J. Trump has reached back into his brand of nativism to accuse a political opponent of color — this time, Nikki Haley — of not being a real American eligible for the presidency as he defends his own eligibility for the ballot under the Constitution.

title: With ‘Echo,’ Alaqua Cox Smashes Boundaries, and Bad Guys’ Faces
description: “I thought in the back of my head, There’s no way I’m going to get this.”

title: Hunter Biden Appears on Capitol Hill as House G.O.P. Votes for Contempt
description: Two House committees voted on Wednesday along party lines to hold Hunter Biden, the president’s son, in contempt of Congress, hours after he surprised Republicans by appearing unannounced on Capitol Hill, prompting a partisan free-for-all.

title: A Fellow Cop Let My Father-In-Law Slide on a Breathalyzer Test. What to Do?
description: My father-in-law hides his drinking and denies it, but when we visit, we see him sneak out to the car and drink vodka from the trunk many times a day. We live close by and see my in-laws quite often; hence we also see him drinking frequently, even though my husband has tried hard to get him to stop.

title: The Saxophone Master Shabaka Hutchings Is on a Fresh Journey: Flutes
description: As Shabaka Hutchings led a concert tribute to Pharoah Sanders in early December, he returned to a familiar equation: funneling gallons of air through his tenor saxophone, transforming it into a corrosive stream of sound.

title: Blocked Toilets Close Eton, Boarding School for Britain’s Elite Sons
description: The first prime minister of Britain, Robert Walpole, went to Eton College. So did Boris Johnson and David Cameron and more than a dozen others.

title: Ecuadoreans Split on President’s Drastic New Measure to Combat Drug Gangs
description: A sense of dread took hold in Ecuador on Wednesday, with the streets empty, schools closed and many people afraid to leave their homes after the disappearance of two gang leaders set off prison riots, police kidnappings and the on-air storming of a TV station.

title: Al Shabab Terrorist Group Captures U.N. Helicopter in Somalia
description: A United Nations helicopter carrying nine passengers was captured in Somalia on Wednesday by the terrorist group Al Shabab after making an emergency landing because of technical difficulties in an area controlled by the group, three senior Somali officials said.

title: OpenAI Unveils App Store for Custom Chatbots
description: OpenAI said on Wednesday that it was opening an app store for people to share customized versions of its popular chatbot, ChatGPT, as the artificial intelligence company works to expand the reach of its flagship technology and turn it into a moneymaker.

title: ‘Gas-Station Heroin’ Sold as Dietary Supplement Alarms Health Officials
description: The young father headed across the parking lot to join the other parents meeting their children’s new preschool teachers. After a few steps, he began sweating and twitching. As the sky reeled, he staggered back to the car, desperate to lie down in the back seat and breathe, hidden by tinted windows.

title: A Way to Improve How Children Read
description: To the Editor:

title: Indian American Leaders in Iowa Say They Feel Abandoned by Nikki Haley
description: With less than a week to go before the Iowa caucuses, leaders with some of the largest and most active Indian and South Asian American associations in the state say Nikki Haley has missed a major opportunity to run up her margins against her opponents: Engaging Indian American voters.

title: What to Know After Severe Storms Hit Vast Areas of the U.S.
description: Strong winds and heavy rain left hundreds of thousands of utility customers in the eastern United States without power on Wednesday. Roads and buildings across a wide region were flooded and battered by the storm, with some rivers and streams still rising.

title: Prolific Challenger of Trump’s Ballot Eligibility Faces Federal Tax Charges
description: A long-shot Republican presidential candidate who has repeatedly, and so far unsuccessfully, tried to have Donald J. Trump thrown off the primary ballot was arrested this week on federal charges of preparing false tax returns for clients.

title: Use of A.D.H.D. Drugs Surged During Pandemic, Study Finds
description: Prescriptions for drugs used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder surged during the coronavirus pandemic, particularly among women and patients ages 20 to 39, according to new research compiled by scholars affiliated with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

title: To Run the British Museum, You’ll Get $275,000 and a Host of Problems
description: Wanted: Someone to restore trust in one of the world’s most visited museums after an embarrassing scandal, handle restitution claims and raise $1.27 billion for a major refurbishment.

title: Severe Storms Sweep Across the Eastern U.S.
description: Heavy rain and powerful winds stretched up the East Coast, flooding streets and buildings. In parts of the South, apparent tornadoes tore through homes.

title: WordleBot’s New Preferred Opening Word: Trace
description: In our recent analysis of 515 million Wordle games played over a year, we noted that a few changes would soon be coming to WordleBot’s dictionary. As of today, those changes are now live — including a new opening word in both regular and hard mode.

title: Menendez Lashed Out in the Senate. Now, He’s Fighting Back in Court.
description: Lawyers for Senator Robert Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat charged with accepting cash and gold bribes, asked a judge on Wednesday to dismiss the indictment, saying overzealous prosecutors were criminalizing normal legislative activity and flouting constitutional protections afforded to members of Congress.

title: One Way to Stay Safe in a Storm: Take Care Around Trees
description: Like homes, cars and electricity lines, trees provide vital services. But they can also be dangerous, even deadly, in storms or when they are not cared for properly.

title: Subway Train Derails in Brooklyn in 2nd Such Episode in a Week
description: A subway train derailed in Brooklyn on Wednesday afternoon, police and fire officials said. It was the second derailment incident in New York City’s mass-transit system in less than a week.

title: Iowa’s Governor Bet on DeSantis. Voters Aren’t Thrilled.
description: Gov. Kim Reynolds of Iowa broke with tradition and with former President Donald J. Trump in November when she endorsed Ron DeSantis for president in her state’s first-in-the-nation caucuses, a move that surprised political observers and Iowa voters alike.

title: Alice Parker, Composer Who Heard Music in Poetry, Dies at 98
description: Alice Parker, whose arrangements of hymns, folk songs, and spirituals were used in concert halls and churches across America, and who composed 11 song cycles and four operas, died on Dec. 24 at her home in Hawley, Mass. She was 98.

title: Amazon Cuts Hundreds of Jobs at Studios and Twitch
description: Amazon is laying off hundreds of employees at its studio division as well as its subsidiary Twitch to reduce costs, the latest in a wave of new job cuts hitting the tech industry.

title: A Dinner Party So Easy You Don’t Even Need Recipes
description: People often tell me they simply can’t cook without a recipe. But often you don’t really need one: You need a technique, a method.

title: ‘The Beekeeper’ Review: Sting Like a, You Know
description: “To bee or not to bee?” That is a question asked to Jason Statham in “The Beekeeper,” a delirious entry in the thriving genre of action flicks about gunslingers who list a different career on their LinkedIn. (See also: “The Painter” and “The Bricklayer,” both released just last week.) The director David Ayer’s previous shoot-em-up, “The Tax Collector,” was woefully short on quips about audits. He and the screenwriter Kurt Wimmer have not made that mistake here. Take a swig of mead every time Statham vows to protect the hive — by which he means society — and you’ll have a fine time. Either way, you won’t remember a thing about the plot.

title: Christopher Nolan Continues Momentum with Directors Guild Nomination
description: The Directors Guild of America announced the nominations for its feature-film award on Wednesday, lending further momentum to nominee Christopher Nolan (“Oppenheimer”), who won the Golden Globe for directing on Sunday.

title: Missing Profits May Be a Problem for the Green Transition
description: In October, the International Energy Agency issued a brief flare of optimism when it suggested that global carbon emissions from fossil fuels may already have peaked.

title: Menendez Motion to Dismiss
description: Lawyers for Senator Robert Menendez filed a motion on Wednesday arguing that the bribery case against him should be dismissed.

title: A School Sheltered Migrants in a Storm. The Hate Calls Poured In.
description: An angry backlash erupted at a Brooklyn high school on Wednesday, after New York City officials housed about 500 migrant families in an auditorium there overnight because of heavy rains and fierce winds at their shelter site.

title: How a TV Show Forced Britain’s Devastating Post Office Scandal Into the Light
description: More than 700 people convicted of a crime they didn’t commit. At least four suicides. A woman sent to jail while pregnant. Bankruptcies. Marriages broken, lives ruined.

title: 1 Killed in Avalanche at Lake Tahoe Ski Resort
description: One person was killed and one other person was injured in an avalanche at a popular ski resort in Lake Tahoe in California on Wednesday, the authorities said.

title: S.E.C. Social Media Hack That Sent Bitcoin Soaring Prompts Investigation
description: The hack of a social media account used by the Securities and Exchange Commission is prompting both internal and external investigations into how the security breach occurred and whether anyone tried to profit from it, said the commission and several legal experts.

title: Trump’s Boldest Argument Yet: Immunity From Prosecution for Assassinations
description: Eight years ago, just before the Iowa caucuses, Donald J. Trump crowed about his invulnerability.

title: An Oatmeal Cookie for Raisin Haters
description: It may come as a shock to legions of chocolate chip devotees, but there’s a small but passionate faction of cookie lovers who prefer oatmeal raisin.

title: Trump Won’t Give Closing Argument at Fraud Trial After Judge Sets Limits
description: Donald J. Trump backed down from delivering his own closing argument in his civil fraud trial after refusing to abide by a judge’s restrictions — including that he not give “a campaign speech” — in the latest clash between Mr. Trump’s political aims and American legal norms.

title: What Did We Learn From a Year in Live Shows?
description: No one on the New York Times pop music staff attends more live shows than Caryn Ganz, the pop music editor. On this week’s Popcast, she reflects on the first full post-pandemic year of live performances, with stadium and arena tours finally back at full strength.

title: Norma Barzman, Blacklisted Screenwriter, Dies at 103
description: Norma Barzman, a screenwriter who moved to Europe in the late 1940s rather than be subject to the congressional investigations and professional ostracism that overtook her industry for a decade, died on Dec. 17 at her home in Beverly Hills, Calif. She was 103 and widely considered to be one of the last surviving victims of the Hollywood blacklist.

title: G.O.P. Opens Mayorkas Impeachment Push With No Evidence of High Crimes
description: House Republicans on Wednesday kicked off formal impeachment hearings against Alejandro N. Mayorkas, the homeland security secretary, accusing him of willfully failing to enforce immigration laws even as leading constitutional experts said there was no basis to do so.

title: Thursday Briefing: The Fight Against Houthi Rebels
description: The U.S. and its allies are trying to figure out how to stop attacks by Houthi rebels based in Yemen against commercial ships in the Red Sea. This comes after American and British forces said yesterday that they intercepted one of the largest barrages of missiles and drones yet.

title: What’s in Our Queue? ‘Don’t Hug Me I’m Scared’ and More
description: I’m an editor who works on features for The Times’s print edition. Here are five things I’ve been enjoying.

title: The Scariest Part About the Boeing 737 Max 9 Blowout
description: You should worry that a crying baby will be in the seat next to you. You should worry that snow in Chicago will snarl air traffic. But you should never, ever have to worry that a plug in the side of your plane — a hidden weak spot — will suddenly blow out at 16,000 feet. That is what happened to Alaska Airlines Flight 1282 shortly after takeoff from Portland, Ore., on Friday.

title: Trump Has Suggested Violence Could Erupt if Court Cases Do Not Go His Way
description: Twice in recent days former President Donald J. Trump has openly suggested that there could be violence should the Supreme Court rule against him in his ballot eligibility dispute, or if the federal case against him for plotting to overturn the 2020 election proceeds, warning of “big, big trouble” and “bedlam in this country.”

title: Standoff at Presidential Palace Shows Poland’s Right Won’t Go Quietly
description: Poland’s bumpy transition to a new government hit dramatic turbulence on Wednesday when a prominent hard-line minister in the former right-wing administration declared himself a “political prisoner” and announced he was going on a hunger strike to protest his arrest following conviction for abuse of power.

title: U.S. Hit by Record Number of High-Cost Disasters in 2023
description: The United States experienced 28 disasters last year that each cost at least $1 billion , the highest number on record and the latest measure of the growing toll of climate change.

title: Regulators Approve New Type of Bitcoin Fund, in Boon for Crypto Industry
description: Federal regulators on Wednesday approved a new financial product that tracks the price of Bitcoin, a landmark moment for the cryptocurrency industry that proponents hope will increase investment in the technology.

title: Adan Canto, ‘The Cleaning Lady’ and ‘X-Men’ Actor, Dies at 42
description: Adan Canto, the Mexican actor known for his roles on television series including “The Cleaning Lady” and “Designated Survivor,” as well as for playing the superhero Sunspot in the film “X-Men: Days of Future Past,” died on Monday. He was 42.

title: Trump’s Argument for Immunity in 2024 Is the Opposite of His Stance in 2021
description: When former President Donald J. Trump appeared before an appeals court in Washington this week to claim he was immune from prosecution for his efforts to overturn the 2020 election, one of his lawyers argued that he should not face criminal charges because the Senate had failed to convict him of similar offenses at an impeachment trial three years ago.

title: After Red Sea Barrage by Houthis, U.S. and Allies Weigh Retaliation
description: The United States and its allies are weighing how to stop attacks on commercial ships in the Red Sea after American and British officials said on Wednesday that their navies had intercepted one of the largest barrages yet of drones and missiles fired from an area controlled by the Houthis, an Iranian-backed group in Yemen.

title: Conservatives Revolt Anew Over Johnson Deal to Avert Shutdown
description: Conservatives thrust the House back into chaos on Wednesday, grinding business to a halt in protest of the spending deal Speaker Mike Johnson struck with Democrats to avert a government shutdown and leaving the funding package in limbo.

title: Setback for Heirs in Long-Running Nazi Art Restitution Case
description: The heirs of a woman who was forced to surrender a painting to the Nazis were dealt a blow on Tuesday in a decades-long legal feud between them and the Spanish museum that now owns the work, when a Federal Court in California ruled that the museum should retain ownership.

title: Christie’s Exit Is Jolted as Hot Mic Picks Up His Unvarnished View of Rivals
description: Former Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey suspended his presidential campaign on Wednesday, but he undermined his effort to stop Donald J. Trump when he sweepingly dismissed his Republican rivals during a hot-mic moment.

title: N.Y.P.D. Will Not Face Budget Cuts After All, Adams Says
description: Mayor Eric Adams said on Wednesday that the city had restored funding to the New York Police Department and would add 600 recruits in April, a reversal of the dire warning he gave in November that there would be a hiring freeze.

title: Christie Caught on Hot Mic Disparaging Haley and DeSantis
description: As speculation about his future in the presidential race swirled, Chris Christie was caught on a hot mic on his campaign’s livestream in a conversation before his scheduled event in Windham, N.H., discussing his Republican rivals in the race.

title: Hunter Biden’s Capitol Visit Surprised Republicans, and His Father’s Advisers
description: When Hunter Biden interrupted a House Oversight Committee vote over holding him in contempt of Congress on Wednesday, Republican lawmakers were not the only ones caught off guard. President Biden’s advisers were surprised to see him there, too.

title: Can Iowa Hold a Proper Caucus for Once?
description: The most-watched early presidential contest in America has been a hot mess for more than a decade.

title: Chris Christie Ended His Presidential Bid
description: Chris Christie, the former New Jersey governor who positioned himself as the Republican candidate for president most willing to attack Donald Trump, dropped out of the race today after months of campaigning failed to secure him more than a sliver of support in polls. In the end, Christie’s attacks against Trump, whom he called unfit for office, appear to have distanced him from the party’s base.

title: Hamas says hostages won’t go home alive as long as Israeli forces remain in Gaza.
description: Israeli hostages held in the Gaza Strip “will not be returned alive” unless Israeli forces leave, a Hamas spokesman said on Wednesday, highlighting the predicament facing the Israeli government: It has vowed to free the hostages, and to pursue the war and defeat Hamas.

title: Women With Depression During or After Pregnancy Face Greater Suicide Risk, Even Years Later
description: Women who experience depression during pregnancy or in the year after giving birth have a greater risk of suicide and attempted suicide — risks that persist for years, two new studies report.

title: Appeals Court Finds DeSantis Violated Prosecutor’s First Amendment Rights
description: Dealing a blow to Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida, a federal court of appeals on Wednesday ruled that he had violated First Amendment protections when he suspended a progressive state prosecutor for political gain.

title: Biden’s Appeal to Black Voters Needs an Overhaul
description: Let’s start here: A second Donald Trump presidency is a disaster scenario.

title: When Democracy Is a Threat
description: The first time I covered a Taiwan “election,” 38 years ago, the island was a dictatorship under martial law, with members of the opposition more likely to be tortured than to gain power.

title: Why Some People Keep Serious Illnesses Private
description: The U.S. defense secretary is facing scrutiny after failing to immediately disclose to the White House his recent prostate-cancer diagnosis and a related hospitalization, a breach of protocol for which he has apologized.

title: Lawyer Tapped to Prosecute Trump in Georgia Is Now Under Scrutiny Himself
description: Before he became the special prosecutor leading the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald J. Trump, Nathan Wade was working as a private defense lawyer and a judge for a municipal court in the Atlanta suburbs.

title: Marisa Pavan, Oscar Nominee for ‘The Rose Tattoo,’ Dies at 91
description: The Italian actress Marisa Pavan never achieved the fame of her twin sister, Pier Angeli, a film ingénue of the 1950s who graced national magazine covers and whose romance with James Dean and subsequent marriage to the singer Vic Damone became the stuff of Hollywood lore.

title: ‘Right Where We Want Him, 30 Points Up’: Chasing Trump in Iowa
description: At the start of the 2024 Republican primary campaign, Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida was considered by many in his party to be the biggest threat to Donald Trump. He was seen as someone who could win over the voters who were tired of Trump’s antics, and also bring along the MAGA movement. But it didn’t work out that way. And as Mr. DeSantis has struggled, one main opponent, former Gov. Nikki Haley of South Carolina, has seen her star — and her standing in the polls — rise.

title: Former Cardinal Is Ruled Not Competent to Stand Trial in Sex Abuse Case
description: The criminal case against a former cardinal who was once one of the most prominent and revered Catholic leaders in the country was suspended Wednesday, possibly ending efforts to prosecute him on sex abuse charges.

title: At Trial, Sotheby’s Says Russian Oligarch Was Sloppy in Buying Art
description: As the opening witness in a civil art fraud trial this week, Mikhail Sazonov testified that his employer, a Russian oligarch, had been tricked to overspend by a Swiss art dealer and that those markups had been boosted by the evaluations of artworks supplied by a Sotheby’s executive.

title: Alaska Airlines and Passengers Face More Disruption Over Boeing Plane
description: For Alaska Airlines and its passengers, a return to normal may take a while.

title: Cockpit Recording’s Erasure Hampers Boeing 737 Max 9 Investigation
description: Officials investigating why a panel on a Boeing 737 Max 9 blew open during an Alaska Airlines flight last week say they are struggling to piece together exactly what happened because the plane’s cockpit voice recorder overwrote itself before it could be retrieved.

title: Newsom Seeks to Close $37.9 Billion Deficit by Cutting Spending and Using Reserves
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom announced on Wednesday that California had a $37.9 billion budget deficit and asked state lawmakers to cover the shortfall by trimming spending and drawing down reserves in an election year.

title: Chris Christie Goes Down Swinging at Trump and Pleading With His Party
description: Chris Christie closed out his second presidential campaign much as he began it, with a blistering and personal takedown of Donald J. Trump designed to prompt a reckoning in his party.

title: 60-Foot Tunnel Under Synagogue Left 2 Buildings Unstable, Officials Say
description: An illegal tunnel beneath one of the most important religious sites in New York City was about 60 feet long and 8 feet across and was not sufficiently reinforced, compromising the stability of parts of two buildings, city officials said Wednesday.

title: The Effects of a Tough Workout
description: Jump to: Today’s Theme | Tricky Clues

title: DeSantis and Haley Clash Over Military Aid to Ukraine
description: After about 30 minutes of debate featuring repeated promotions of campaign websites and dozens of permutations of the word “lie,” Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida and Nikki Haley diverged on actual policy: the war in Ukraine.

title: Haley Hits DeSantis on Disney: Government Shouldn’t ‘Bully’ Companies
description: It was a feud that cost Florida 2,000 jobs under Gov. Ron DeSantis. And Nikki Haley pounced.

title: Trump Suggests He’s Decided on a Vice President: ‘I Know Who It’s Going to Be’
description: Former President Donald J. Trump, the front-runner in the Republican presidential primary, said on Wednesday that he knew who he would choose to be his running mate.

title: Thursday Briefing
description: U.S. and British warships intercepted 21 drones and missiles fired on Tuesday from areas of Yemen controlled by the Iranian-backed Houthi militia, officials said. The U.S. and its allies are now weighing how to shut down other attacks against commercial ships in the Red Sea.

title: Haley and DeSantis Call Each Other Liars
description: Several times during the debate, Nikki Haley referred the audience to a website called DeSantisLies.com, while Ron DeSantis compared her to Democrats.

title: Google Cuts Hundreds of Jobs in Engineering and Other Divisions
description: Google laid off hundreds of workers in several divisions Wednesday night, seeking to lower expenses as it focuses on artificial intelligence and joining a wave of other companies cutting tech jobs this year.

title: ‘I’m Not Going to Have Time for Retribution,’ Trump Says at Town Hall
description: Former President Donald J. Trump, who for months has expressed openness to retaliating against his political enemies if he returns to the White House and has vowed to have federal prosecutors investigate them, downplayed his interest in pursuing retribution at a televised town hall on Wednesday.

title: Haley and DeSantis Go After Trump
description: Ron DeSantis said that if Donald J. Trump were the Republican nominee, it would give Democrats the upper hand, while Nikki Haley called for bringing “sanity back to America.”

title: 5 Takeaways From the Haley-DeSantis Debate and Trump’s Town Hall
description: Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis traded attacks on a debate stage on Wednesday night as Donald J. Trump basked in the applause of a friendly audience on a different television network, dueling appearances that showcased how the Republican primary race increasingly feels like a contest for second place.

title: Who Won the Debate? Haley Struggled to Outshine DeSantis, Analysts Say
description: With the Iowa caucuses days away, two of the remaining Republican presidential candidates — Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley — clashed on the debate stage on Wednesday night over the economy, foreign policy and their records in their states, Florida and South Carolina.

title: Chris Christie, We Miss You!
description: I wish Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis had shown a quarter as much contempt for Donald Trump as they did for each other.

title: Quotation of the Day: A TV Drama Finally Forces Action on Britain’s Post Office Scandal
description: “Everyone likes an underdog, and we had underdogs in spades.”

title: Corrections: Jan. 11, 2024
description: An article on Wednesday about the Federal Aviation Administration’s decision to delay safety inspections of Boeing’s 737 Max 9 referred incorrectly to the feedback that prompted a revision of inspection instructions for the airliners. The F.A.A. said the changes were based on feedback the manufacturer had received, but it did not say that the feedback came from the agency.

title: Word of the Day: obfuscation
description: The word obfuscation has appeared in 36 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Nov. 25 in “Everybody Knows Flo From Progressive. Who Is Stephanie Courtney?” by Caity Weaver:

title: Stephen Colbert Prays That Trump Can Deliver
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Rare North Atlantic Right Whale Calf Is Expected to Die From Injuries
description: A rare North Atlantic right whale calf spotted off the coast of South Carolina is expected to die after its head, mouth and lips were split open, likely by a boat propeller, officials said.

title: Today’s Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for today’s puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to today’s Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle — and emotional — support.

title: Subway Delayed Again? Might Be Caused by a Brake Prank.
description: The collision between two subway trains that injured dozens of people in Manhattan last week began with what has become a routine problem in New York City’s mass transit system — pranksters pulling emergency brakes.

title: Civil Conversation
description: What do you think this image is saying? How does it relate to or comment on society or current events? Can you relate to it personally? What is your opinion of its message?

title: The Quest to Unlock New Haven’s Pizza Moment
description: New Haveners and Yale graduates alike size one another up with a handshake and a single question: What’s your favorite pizza place?

title: Trump’s Fraud Trial Draws to an End With Closing Arguments
description: Donald J. Trump’s civil fraud trial concluded on Thursday much as it unfolded over the past three months: in chaos, with the former president insulting the judge to his face, lashing out at the New York attorney general who brought the case and declaring himself “an innocent man.”

title: Common Credits Ralph Ellison for Pointing Him Toward Music
description: What books are on your night stand?

title: Clown Cardio Doesn’t Take Exercise Seriously
description: Whenever Alex Lee mentions Clown Cardio, he is met with some confusion.

title: Sweetie, I’ll Be Back at 2 A.M.
description: Brianna Michaud’s ’90s childhood was filled with sleepovers at friends’ houses. Her mother sometimes came inside the house and chatted with the parents for a few minutes, but sensitive topics like bodily autonomy, gun safety or technology use — except for the rule that she not watch anything rated PG-13 or higher — weren’t the kinds of things discussed.

title: Can Dieting Actually Lead to Long-Term Weight Loss?
description: Dieting has long been viewed as the path to smaller bodies and better health. Stick to the right diet, the $75 billion U.S. weight loss industry may have you think, and you, too, can lose weight and keep it off.

title: ‘The Book of Clarence’ Review: Messiahs Wherever You Look
description: The subject of a Jesus movie is technically Jesus. But every movie based on the biblical account of Jesus — and there are many such movies, stretching back to 1898 — says at least as much about the people who made it as it does about the man himself.

title: ‘Apolonia, Apolonia’ Review: A Whole Life in Art
description: “For as long as I can remember, I’ve seen the world through my camera,” a woman’s voice says in the early moments of “Apolonia, Apolonia.” Onscreen, we’re watching — presumably through that same camera — a young woman, strong features, entrancing smile, dark circles under her eyes, bearing the expression of a person who’s not afraid of the lens one bit. “But no motif,” the voice continues, “has caught my eye as she did.”

title: ‘Inshallah a Boy’ Review: Where the Male Line Is the Only Line
description: Before things take an unjust turn in Amjad Al Rasheed’s tense and accomplished directorial debut, “Inshallah a Boy,” a wife and husband lie in bed discussing the timing to conceive a second child. There is something sweet in the exhaustion of the husband, Adnan (Mohammad Suleiman), and surprising in his admission to his wife, Nawal (Mouna Hawa), that he’s the cause of their fertility issues. This promising exchange will be their last.

title: Judge John Hodgman on the ‘Frosty Slaw Man Salad’ Recipe
description: Ryley writes: My future mother-in-law, Maria, recently discovered the “Frosty Slaw Man Salad,” a recipe from a 1960s mayonnaise marketing campaign. It’s a mayo-gelatin-cottage-cheese-cabbage concoction in the shape of a demonic snowman. She is determined to make it! Her husband, Daniel, is vehemently opposed. Who is right?

title: Will Chatbots Teach Your Children?
description: Sal Khan, the chief executive of Khan Academy, gave a rousing TED Talk last spring in which he predicted that A.I. chatbots would soon revolutionize education.

title: Fresh Inflation Data Shows Intact, but Bumpy, Cool-Down
description: Consumer price data released Thursday showed Federal Reserve officials, the White House and American households that inflation continued to slow at the end of 2023, capping a year in which the price increases bedeviling families and policymakers cooled in earnest.

title: Elton John’s First Auction in 21 Years Has It All: Boots to Banksy.
description: Elton John is downsizing — and the superstar’s former penthouse residence in Atlanta has been emptied for a series of auctions at Christie’s starting on Feb. 21. The items are expected to bring in an estimated $10 million.

title: State Legislators, Wary of Deceptive Election Ads, Tighten A.I. Rules
description: When experts in artificial intelligence recently showed a gathering of state legislators a deepfake image that had been generated by A.I. in early 2022, depicting former presidents Donald J. Trump and Barack Obama playing one-on-one basketball, the crowd chuckled at how rudimentary it was.

title: When You Return Those Pants, There’s a Price You Don’t See
description: January is a time to redo, revise and recommit. It is also the time to return things.

title: Inflation Is Moderating, but Pressure Remains on Biden
description: President Biden has yet to benefit from moderating inflation, and data set for release on Thursday could complicate the White House’s attempts to show progress on rising prices.

title: Does Learning to Be a Good Writer Still Matter in the Age of A.I.?
description: Are you a good writer? Do you enjoy the craft?

title: Andy Reid, the All-Time-Great Chiefs Coach, Makes Football Fun
description: Andy Reid, the coach of the Kansas City Chiefs, has won more than 250 games in his career, fourth all-time, which puts him high on any list of the N.F.L.’s greatest coaches. Most of the others in that pantheon are men who personify the sport’s militaristic soul — Vince Lombardi, for example, the fabled coach of the 1960s-era Green Bay Packers, or Reid’s contemporary, the grim Bill Belichick of the New England Patriots. But Reid is no Lombardi or Belichick; he’s Steve Jobs. He’s a designer, a tinkerer, a product engineer who imbues his football with creativity and even an occasional touch of whimsy.

title: Six Degrees of Self-Help, Nora Ephron and ‘Mommie Dearest’
description: “How do people get to be the insecure, weak, self-deprecating wretches to whom this book is addressed?” Harry Schwartz wrote in his Times review of “How to Be Your Own Best Friend,” a self-help book that celebrated its 26th week as a best seller 50 years ago this week.

title: Is What’s Good for Taylor Tomlinson’s Career Bad for Her Life?
description: In September, the night before the comic Taylor Tomlinson made her Radio City Music Hall debut, she called one of her three siblings in tears, asking: “Why do I feel like it’s not enough?”

title: Will You Vote for Trump Again?
description: There is no way around it: The Iowa caucuses on Monday, the kickoff of the 2024 presidential election, are not really about competing visions for the future of the Republican Party. They are not a battle between dueling ideologies or policy priorities or America’s role in the world.

title: I Have Covid. Should I Take Paxlovid?
description: As hospitalizations and deaths from Covid-19 rise, fueled by a fast-moving new variant that now accounts for a majority of U.S. cases, Paxlovid can help protect patients from some of the worst outcomes of the illness.

title: How a Congressman Wants to Honor Roberto Clemente
description: Good morning. It’s Thursday. Today we’ll find out why a congressman from the Bronx is pressing for a coin to commemorate a baseball player from the Pittsburgh Pirates. We’ll also see what to expect as Donald Trump’s civil fraud trial moves into its final phase.

title: For the Sake of College Athletes Everywhere, Jim Harbaugh Should Remain at Michigan
description: Some 25 million Americans watched with heavenly joy (or as the case may be, in Ohio, infernal dread) as the Michigan Wolverines defeated the Washington Huskies in the college football national championship on Monday. This was Michigan’s first national title since 1997, and only its second since 1948.

title: Seeing Isamu Noguchi Through Someone Else’s Eyes
description: One of the more revolutionary works of art on display in New York right now is a four-minute-long film nearly 80 years old. Called “Visual Variations on Noguchi,” it was shot in Isamu Noguchi’s Greenwich Village studio sometime in 1945 or ’46. Wielding the camera was Marie Menken, a Brooklyn-born daughter of Lithuanian immigrants who had, until this studio visit, chiefly been a painter.

title: Scientists Scramble to Keep Dog Aging Project Alive
description: In late 2019, scientists began searching for 10,000 Americans willing to enroll their pets in an ambitious new study of health and longevity in dogs. The researchers planned to track the dogs over the course of their lives, collecting detailed information about their bodies, lifestyles and home environments. Over time, the scientists hoped to identify the biological and environmental factors that kept some dogs healthy in their golden years — and uncover insights about aging that could help both dogs and humans lead longer, healthier lives.

title: The Case for Trump … by Someone Who Wants Him to Lose
description: Barring a political miracle or an act of God, it is overwhelmingly likely that Donald Trump will again be the Republican Party’s nominee for president. Assuming the Democratic nominee in the fall is Joe Biden, polls show Trump with a better-than-even chance of returning to the White House next year.

title: After Years in Washington, a Couple Found More Value in Baltimore. What Could They Afford?
description: Figuring they would need to retire and sell their business before they could afford a new home in the D.C. area, two empty nesters pulled up stakes and tried a place with ‘more bang for your buck.’

title: A Frugal Opera Superfan’s Surprise Gift: $1.7 Million for the Arts
description: When Lois Kirschenbaum, a cultural aficionado who was a fixture in the standing room section of the Metropolitan Opera for more than half a century, died in 2021 at 88, star singers gave tributes and fellow fans offered remembrances.

title: A Clash of Civilizations Brought to Life
description: The Aug. 13, 2021 edition of The New York Times failed to mention the 500th anniversary of the fall of Tenochtitlan, the erstwhile Aztec capital out of which Mexico City was born. Álvaro Enrigue noticed. Of course.

title: The Winner of Last Night’s Debate ‘Owned the Stage’
description: Opinion columnists and contributors assess the candidates in Iowa.

title: Christie’s Exit Should Give Haley a Chance in New Hampshire. Will It Be Enough?
description: Eight years ago, Chris Christie gave Donald J. Trump the biggest political assist of the 2016 campaign.

title: ‘Frozen Garlic!’ Taiwan Likes Its Democracy Loud and Proud
description: Huang Chen-yu strode onto an outdoor stage in a southern Taiwanese county, whooping and hollering as she roused the crowd of 20,000 into a joyous frenzy — to welcome a succession of politicians in matching jackets.

title: With Chris Christie Out, Nikki Haley Is Poised to Benefit in New Hampshire
description: The former New Jersey governor Chris Christie’s decision on Wednesday to drop out of the presidential race shook up a contest for the Republican nomination that had appeared to be former President Donald J. Trump’s for the taking, giving a huge shot of adrenaline to Nikki Haley just five days before ballots begin to be cast in the monthslong nomination fight.

title: Peacock Enters Uncharted Waters by Streaming N.F.L. Playoff Game
description: On Saturday night, NBCUniversal will make media history. For the first time, a National Football League playoff game — this one featuring the Kansas City Chiefs and the Miami Dolphins — will appear exclusively on a streaming service.

title: What Does a Hard-Boiled Detective Do in Retirement?
description: In an early scene in “Monsieur Spade,” a new six-part series from AMC, the American detective Sam Spade, played by Clive Owen, is lying on his side, grimacing as a doctor examines his nether regions. “Best prostate of the morning,” the doctor says cheerfully, snapping off his rubber gloves. Then he motions Spade to his office to tell him he has emphysema and must stop smoking.

title: The Parade of Unsettled Weather Will Continue Into the Weekend
description: There has been a pretty remarkable parade of intense storm systems this past week, Greg Carbin, the branch chief of forecast operations for the National Weather Service, said on Wednesday. And it isn’t over.

title: Food Delivery Workers, Overlooked in Life, Are Honored in Death
description: After the brass band packed up its instruments, Sergio Solano and two other food delivery workers walked a white bicycle to an overpass within view of the United Nations headquarters.

title: The Threat of a Wider War in the Middle East
description: A recent string of attacks across the Middle East has raised concerns that the war between Hamas and Israel is spreading, and might put pressure on other countries like Iran and the United States to get more involved.

title: Blinken Meets With el-Sisi in Egypt to Discuss Plight of Palestinians in Gaza
description: Antony J. Blinken, the U.S. secretary of state, met on Thursday with President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt in Cairo to discuss the dire situation of Palestinian civilians in the Israel-Hamas war and what will happen in Gaza when the conflict ends.

title: Republican Debate Takeaways, and Hunter Biden on Capitol Hill
description: The New York Times Audio app is home to journalism and storytelling, and provides news, depth and serendipity. If you haven’t already, download it here — available to Times news subscribers on iOS — and sign up for our weekly newsletter.

title: Inspections, Bottlenecks and Safety Concerns Hinder Gaza Aid
description: The trucks carrying aid for Gaza stop for exhaustive inspections by Israeli authorities. They can pass through two border crossings only during limited hours. Inside the territory, vehicles travel over a landscape of rubble and ruined roads to distribute the aid to desperate, hungry crowds.

title: Israel Adesanya, M.M.A. Star, Narrowly Avoids Drunk-Driving Conviction
description: Just weeks after being charged with driving under the influence in Auckland, New Zealand, last year, Israel Adesanya, a former two-time middleweight mixed martial arts champion, sought to project humility and remorse.

title: Top Natural Gas Producers Announce Multibillion-Dollar Merger
description: Chesapeake Energy and Southwestern Energy, two of the largest natural gas producers in the United States, announced plans to merge on Thursday, in an all-stock deal worth $7.4 billion. The new company would become one of the largest energy producers in the United States, with a significant presence in Louisiana and Texas.

title: Crime on the Decline
description: In the chaotic early months of the Covid pandemic, when the U.S. was also going through the aftermath of George Floyd’s murder, violent crime rose across the country. Murders in 2020 increased at the fastest rate since national statistics began in 1960. Other crimes, like shootings and car thefts, also increased.

title: ‘Driving Madeleine’ Review: A Nonagenarian in Paris
description: A prickly cabdriver gains perspective thanks to a chatty nonagenarian.
